lead_paragraph: A former women’s basketball coach who sued Fresno State for sex discrimination said she had been hired as the general manager of a minor league professional men’s team — and she is negotiating a movie deal. The coach, Stacy Johnson-Klein, will begin her new job with the Lawton Fort Sill Cavalry, the Continental Basketball Association’s champion, on Friday. She reached a $9 million settlement with Fresno State last month.
